meanings.sent1: I will start defragging my computer to make it run faster.
meanings.sent2: She spends hours defragging her computer every month.
meanings.sent3: After defragging my computer, it felt like it had a nice, relaxing massage.
meanings.sent4: Defragging is like tidying up a messy room, making everything neat and organized.
meanings.sent5: The sound of defragging is oddly satisfying, like rain on a tin roof.

meanings.definition: The act of defragmenting a computer disk
meanings.sent1: Defragging is an important maintenance task for computer users.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a significant improvement in speed after the defragging was complete.
meanings.sent3: The defragging process can be quite mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The defragging of the hard drive was like a dance of data rearrangement.
meanings.sent5: The defragging tool made the computer feel brand new again.
